skill.name: testing-skills-with-subagents
skill.description: Use when creating or editing skills, before deployment, to verify they work under pressure and resist rationalization - applies RED-GREEN-REFACTOR cycle to process documentation by running baseline without skill, writing to address failures, iterating to close loopholes
skill.summary: Use when creating or editing skills, before deployment, to verify they work under pressure and resis...
skill.author: DYAI2025

security_audit.summary: Pure documentation skill containing only markdown files. No code execution, no file writes, no network calls, no external commands. Contains testing methodology guidelines only.

content.value_statement: Skills fail under pressure when agents find rationalizations to skip them. This skill applies TDD principles to skill development, ensuring skills enforce discipline even when agents want to bypass them. Create bulletproof skills that resist rationalization.
actual_capabilities: Create pressure test scenarios with combined time, sunk cost, and authority pressures
Run baseline tests without skill to reveal natural agent failures and rationalizations
Apply GREEN phase to write skills addressing specific documented failures
REFACTOR phase to close loopholes by adding counters for each rationalization type
Use meta-testing to diagnose why skills fail and improve their clarity
Verify skills remain compliant under maximum pressure before deployment
limitations: Only tests skills with rules that can be violated - not suitable for reference-only skills
Requires the TDD skill as prerequisite background knowledge
Does not test pure reference skills without behavioral rules
Testing requires running actual agent scenarios - not automated

use_cases.title: Validate New Skills
use_cases.description: Before deploying a new skill, verify it prevents the specific failures it was designed to address.

use_cases.title: Stress Test Discipline Skills
use_cases.description: Test skills that enforce processes like TDD, testing requirements, or code review compliance.

use_cases.title: Bulletproof Critical Workflows
use_cases.description: Ensure critical process skills resist rationalization when speed and shortcuts tempt agents.

prompt_templates.title: Run Baseline Test
prompt_templates.prompt: Run this scenario WITHOUT the [skill-name] skill active: [insert pressure scenario]. Document exactly what the agent does and their rationalizations verbatim.

prompt_templates.title: Verify Compliance
prompt_templates.prompt: Run this scenario WITH the [skill-name] skill active: [insert pressure scenario]. Does the agent follow the rules? What justifications do they provide?

prompt_templates.title: Find Loopholes
prompt_templates.prompt: Run [scenario] under maximum pressure. Agent violated the skill? Document their exact rationalization - this reveals a loophole to close.

prompt_templates.title: Meta-Test Clarity
prompt_templates.prompt: Agent chose [wrong option] despite having the skill. Ask: How could the skill be written to make compliance crystal clear? Add their suggestion verbatim.

output_examples.input: Test my new TDD enforcement skill with a scenario where agent spent 3 hours coding and forgot tests
output: RED Phase Result: Agent chose to write tests after, rationalizing 'I already manually tested it'
GREEN Phase: Skill updated with 'Delete means delete' principle
REFACTOR Result: New loophole found - 'I'm following the spirit not the letter'
Final verification: Agent complies under pressure, cites skill directly

best_practices: Always run baseline tests without the skill first - you cannot fix what you have not observed
Combine 3+ pressures in scenarios (time, sunk cost, exhaustion, authority) to reveal real rationalizations
Document exact agent rationalizations verbatim - generic fixes do not close specific loopholes
anti_patterns: Skipping RED phase and writing skill based on assumptions rather than observed failures
Using single-pressure scenarios that agents easily resist - real pressure combines multiple factors
Stopping after first GREEN pass - continue REFACTOR until no new rationalizations emerge

faq.question: Is this skill compatible with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code?
faq.answer: Works with Claude and Claude Code. Skills are Claude-specific and may not function in Codex environments.

faq.question: What makes a skill worth testing?
faq.answer: Test skills that have compliance costs, enforce discipline, or contradict immediate goals like speed over quality.

faq.question: Can I integrate this with CI/CD pipelines?
faq.answer: This skill requires human judgment to run agent scenarios. It is a manual testing methodology, not automated.

faq.question: Does this skill access or modify my files?
faq.answer: No file modifications occur. The skill is purely documentation for running mental test scenarios on agents.

faq.question: Why did the agent ignore a clear skill?
faq.answer: Agents rationalize under pressure. Use meta-testing to diagnose: was it unclear, not seen, or deliberately ignored?

faq.question: How is this different from regular TDD?
faq.answer: Same RED-GREEN-REFACTOR cycle, but tests are agent pressure scenarios and 'code' is skill documentation text.
